experience: You and Lauretta (Laurie) both know Judith McRae, Beth Gray (Newberg), CSM, and 27 others
You both worked at Charles Schwab
Lauretta (Laurie) worked at Charles Schwab before you started
I hired a bunch of "no" men instead of "yes" men.  Here's what happened:
*A junior developer reviewed an email & truthfully said "the first 6 were well written but you can do better on the rest." (I'm his boss' boss.) Ugh. He ended up saving our clients pain.
*I had a senior designer push back HARD on one of my product suggestions. He finally changed my mind.  He saved us hours of unnecessary work.

*I had an entire team light up my phone with "No!" "Nope!" "Pass!!!" and "Do not pass GO!" when a candidate we were interviewing said something offensive.  Pretty sure we rescued our team from future abuse and the pain that goes with it.
Say "yes" to hiring people who will tell you "NO!".
The Children's Museum of Sonoma County has opened their Costume Shop.
They have HUNDREDS of costumes available for anyone that is displaced from the recent fires OR needs extra help this Halloween.
If your child needs a costume, please visit the Museum during these hours:
The museum is located at 1835 W Steele Ln, Santa Rosa, CA 95403 and to learn more about the museum, go to: http://www.cmosc.org/

Business Advisor / Private and family-owned businesses / Trend Spotting / Compliance Industries: Food Wholesale, Retail & Grocery, Services, TradesSometimes business owners manage to succeed at one level, and then find it challenging to grow beyond a certain point.  If your company has made it past two years congratulations!  You beat the statistics of 8 in 10 businesses fail in the first two years.  Now what do you have to do to thrive? ✓ ENTREPRENEURS- Ready to take your business to the next level and create a lifestyle friendly business you love? Build your best business to attract your ideal clients easily and effortlessly while having time for family, friends, and community.✓ Business Owners - Want to share your products and services in a bigger way?  There some basic techniques you can learn get you to your revenue goals. These big corporate tips work for companies, big, medium, and small.  But very few small companies use these techniques that will allow you to serve a lot more people, a lot faster. Envision your business. Develop strategy, build a high performance team, develop your ideal products and services that are priced and distributed efficiently and effectively.  Think outside the box rather than depend on circumstances like economy, and regulations to define success. Align  with the right people, right opportunities, and right experiences to architect your dream business.  Serve your ideal clients.Coaching programs:✓ Free Strategy Workbook http://boomingbusinesswithease   ✓ Booming Business with Ease Starter group program✓Private One-on-One CoachingSpeaking:✓5 Steps to Grow your booming Business with Ease✓It’s all in the Family—How to live, work, and play together Schedule a Complimentary 30-Minute Business Checkup!http://www.scheduleyou.in/Gyz2f5sU6Specialties include, strategy, planning, high performance teams, business operations, business systems design and implementation from marketing & sales to financial planning.

recommendations: Aimée Lyndon-Adams
Business Coaching|Public Speaking|Training|Energy Healing for Professionals
July 5, 2016, Aimée worked with Lauretta (Laurie) in different groups

Laurie spoke at our live monthly event, Developing Alliances: Professional Gatherings for Extraordinary Women.  Her topic was "3 Proven Steps to Unleash Your Feminine Power and Envision Your Dreams" and through her speaking expertise, approachable and charismatic presence and the power of her message she touched every woman in the room!  Her interactive exercises helped us to understand how much we actually do in life, hidden roles that demand time and energy. She shared how prioritizing what really has heart and meaning and regularly practicing self-care can shift the balance in our lives, enriching us all.  Laurie is an expert presenter and I highly recommend her.

Senior Desktop Systems Support Analyst at Asurion
April 19, 2008, Lauretta (Laurie) was senior to Alex but didn’t manage directly

Lauretta was one of the most detail oriented, organized and professional people I've ever had the pleasure of working with.  Not only did she spearhead the effort of creating a new way to print Checks for our Branches via TN3270 emulation converted to Windows, but she also gave fair recognition to all those who were involved in the project.  Her efforts were greatly appreciated at the time, and she continues to amaze me with her superior professionalism.

Erin Evers, CFS
Certified Food Scientist; Technical Sales Manager at SPI Group
August 15, 2013, Lauretta (Laurie) managed Erin directly

I would like to recommend Erin Kamei Evers.  She began working at Chef-K, Inc. in May 2008 as a contractor.  By January 2009 she was hired as a full time employee.  Erin is stellar.  Initially she was brought on for her food science experience.  She developed the standards and procedures for nutrition reporting in all of Chef-K ® curriculum, she subsequently became responsible for all operations, including recipe testing, procedures from development through staging and production as well as fulfillment of all Chef-K curriculum.Chef-K was incorporated in May 2008, formerly Laurie’s Culinary Camp.  Because the company was a start-up at the time, each employee had to be very flexible.  Erin is definitely flexible.  She contributed whenever and wherever an extra hand was needed.  She did everything from helping to blog, test our website during development, submitted curriculum to US copyright office, completed USDA registration, recipe tested, assisted instructors and taught week-long culinary camps.  She has a positive attitude and learns quickly.  She is a manager’s dream and I know having previously managed a team of 50 plus as an officer at a fortune 500 company.  She is one of the best I’ve ever worked with over the years.As a manager I highly recommend Erin.  She will contribute to your organization and be a great addition to your team.  Laurie Zerga, founder Chef-K, Culinary Health Education for Kids

summary: Business Advisor | Executive Coach | Business Consultant | Keynote Speaker | Trainer | Executive Development Are you a business owner or CEO that wants to:✓ Work with corporations, institutions, or government agencies?✓ Sell your product or Service Nationally?✓ Replicate your successful business?I’m the Founder of Booming Business with Ease. Let me help you reconnect with your vision, make more money, and work less hours, using techniques and processes big corporations use to leverage your time and investment while growing your business.✓ Analyze✓ Strategize ✓ Systematize As an Italian American raising two daughters climbing the corporate ladder from international engineering and technology firms to an officer in financial services, I learned to successfully navigate the many roles society mandates of women AND learn corporate systems and methodology.  I transitioned first to ✓ Business consultant then a ✓ Heart-based entrepreneur of a national company Chef-K®, culinary health education for kids.    ✓ Inspirational speaker to women's groups is an on-going passion✓ A business coach and consultant today, I help business owners double, triple, and even 10X their bottom line with ease.I love supporting business owners who want to follow their heart to make their life and their community better as they grow their business. Today can be the day you begin to envision a lucrative lifestyle friendly business you love. Sound like you? Schedule a Complimentary 30-Minute Booming Business with Balance session TODAY!http://www.scheduleyou.in/Gyz2f5sU6 AND/ORHere's a Booming Business with Ease Strategy Workbook that has helped me to start my dream business. Get a copy of the FREE REPORT https://boomingbusinesswithease.com Specialties: Business Architect / Inspirational Speaker / Strategic Planning /  Marketing and Sales  / High-performance team building / Business Finance
name: Lauretta (Laurie) (Ongaro) Zerga
